Led by director Eimuntas Nekrošius, one of Europe's most respected theatre masters since the fall of the Iron Curtain, Meno fortas' theatrical world weaves a rich visual tapestry illuminated with powerful symbolisms of natural and material elements. In Nekrošius' Othello, this four-hour tour de force of Shakespeare's tale of passion and jealousy has received wide critical acclaim everywhere it performed and will leave you yearning for more. Without being indulgent, Nekrošius allows the dramatic action to unwind and decompress, imbuing it with a life and tempo of its own, creating a complex spiritual adventure arousing both anxiety and ecstasy. The recurrent laconic and perturbing elemental metaphors of water, fire and wood fill the space with astounding beauty. "The shattering power of visual suggestion and the director's rare ability in a deep analysis of the text distinguishes the work of Nekrošius." — Il Giorno "Passion raging in the performance of Meno fortas surpassed all imaginable boundaries. Five hours…passed by without notice for those who were lucky enough to get seats to the new performance by Eimuntas Nekrošius." — Moskovskij Komsomolec
